name.description:
The name of this Marathon autoscaler service inside DC/OS base Marathon.
If not specified otherwise, this name will also be used for the framework name, dcos service name, zk path and mesos role.
To create a nested path, please specify a group.

group.description: The group of this Marathon service inside DC/OS base Marathon. If a group is defined, the id of this service will be group/name

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon autoscaler instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon autoscaler instance.

instances.description: Number of Marathon autoscaler instances to run.

autoscaler.description: Environment variables passed to the Marathon Autoscaler

marathon-master.description: The DNS hostname or IP of your Marathon

max-mem-percent.description: The Max percent of Mem Usage averaged across all Application Instances to trigger autoscale (ie. 80)

max-cpu-time.description: The max percent of CPU Usage averaged across all Application Instances to trigger autoscale (ie. 80)

min-mem-percent.description: The min percent of Mem Usage averaged across all Application Instances to trigger autoscale (ie. 55)

min-cpu-time.description: The min percent of CPU Usage averaged across all Application Instances to trigger autoscale (ie. 50)

trigger-mode.description: Which metric(s) to trigger Autoscale (and, or, cpu, mem)

max-instances.description: The Max instances that should ever exist for this application (ie. 20)

marathon-app.description: Marathon Application Name to Configure autoscale for from the Marathon UI

min-instances.description: Minimum number of instances to maintain

cool-down-factor.description: Number of cycles to avoid scaling again

trigger-number.description: Number of cycles to avoid scaling again

interval.description: Time in seconds to wait between checks (ie. 20)

userid.description: UserID used with a password or with a secret

password.description: Password to use with UserID when not using a service account

secret.description: secret to use for accessing the DC/OS cluster.
